intro: Diplocyclos decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive cyclos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glandular surface. It is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
